intro: Astragalus kerianus, commonly known as the Chinese milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to China. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces cylindrical pods that contain several small, round seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Astragalus kerianus is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
